thread.title: Best of 2024: Team USA's triumph and international hoops highlights
thread.title_full: Best of 2024: Team USA's triumph and international hoops highlights

author: Cat Ariail
title: Best of 2024: Team USA's triumph and international hoops highlights
text:
Filed under:
FIBA/World Olympics WNBA Players Overseas Best of 2024: Team USA gets another gold, Fenerbahçe goes back-to-back and the game’s global growth International basketball assumed a more prominent stage in 2024, headlined by the Paris Olympics, where Team USA survived to win an eighth-straight gold. Players also impressed in EuroLeague Women, the WCBA and the WNBL, as Swish Appeal captured throughout the year.
By Cat Ariail Dec 26, 2024, 3:00pm EST / new Share this story Share this on Facebook Share this on Twitter
Share this on Reddit
Share All sharing options Share All sharing options for: Best of 2024: Team USA gets another gold, Fenerbahçe goes back-to-back and the game’s global growth
Reddit
Pocket
Flipboard Email
A’ja Wilson celebrates Team USA clinching the gold medal at the 2024 Olympic Games. Photo by Gregory Shamus/Getty Images Cat Ariail has written for Swish Appeal since 2018, serving as Editor-in-Chief since August 2023. She also has a PhD in US history, with a focus on women's sports. As it was an Olympic year, international basketball assumed a starring role in the basketball stories of 2024.
It was a year that testified to the increasing international depth of the women’s game, which not only was on display in Paris, but also throughout the competitions of EuroLeague Women, the WCBA and the WNBL. Here’s a look back at Swish Appeal’s coverage of the global game:
Tested Team USA triumphs
Team USA. Photo by Tim Clayton/Corbis via Getty Images The expectation was that Team USA would capture an eighth-straight gold medal. They did so—barely. The Americans survived a hard-fought gold medal game against the host French to win the program’s 10th overall Olympic gold.
Related
2024 Olympic Games: Can any team prevent Team USA from winning an eighth-straight gold medal? 2024 Olympic Games: Team USA, France, Belgium and Australia advance to semifinals 2024 Olympic Games: Team USA, France advance to the gold medal match 2024 Olympic Games: Will Team USA fend off France to win an eighth-straight gold medal? 2024 Olympic Games: Team USA survives the ultimate test from France to win gold High-quality Olympic action
Gabby Williams. Photo by Jean Catuffe/Getty Images Despite Team USA’s triumph, the 2024 Olympics demonstrated the increased depth of talent from around the globe. While Canada disappointed, Belgium, Nigeria and France all impressed. Several WNBA players also enjoyed star turns on the Olympic stage.
Related
Canada’s four WNBA stars could make a serious impact at the 2024 Paris Olympics Interview: Ify Okoro is ready to lead Nigeria at the 2024 Paris Olympics 2024 Olympic Games: France, Gabby Williams will have a say in who medals in Paris 2024 Olympic Games: Belgium, Meesseman and Vanloo have their eyes on the gold medal in Paris 2024 Olympic Games: Unheralded WNBA players Megan Gustafson, Nyara Sabally enjoy star turn in Paris 2024 Olympic Games: Nigeria’s Ezinne Kalu headlines 5x5 group stage standouts 2024 Olympic Games: Swish Appeal’s top takeaways from Paris Team USA 3x3 perseveres
Team USA 3x3. Photo by Jari Pestelacci/Eurasia Sport Images/Getty Images For awhile, it looked like the 2024 Olympics were going to be a disaster for Team USA’s 3x3 squad. The foursome, however, stuck together, persevering to capture the bronze medal as the German side won gold.
Related
2024 Olympic Games: United States begins 3x3 gold medal defense against Germany 2024 Olympic Games: United States faces China in crucial pool game before play-in begins 2024 Olympic Games: Can Team USA capture a second-straight 3x3 gold medal? 2024 Olympic Games: Germany wins gold in 3x3 basketball Fenerbahçe still owns the EuroLeague
Fenerbahçe. Photo by ALTAN GOCHER/Hans Lucas via AFP/AFP via Getty Images Players familiar to WNBA fans continued to thrive in EuroLeague Women competition in 2024.
Related
EuroLeague Women: Five WNBA players who have impressed during group play EuroLeague Women: Emma Meesseman, Marina Mabrey headline Swish Appeal’s 2023-24 All-Group Teams EuroLeague Women also served as a venue for WNBA talents who, stateside, often are not featured players to assume the spotlight, as displayed by Bridget Carleton’s record-breaking game for UNI Győr.
Related
Interview: Bridget Carleton talks making EuroLeague Women history, playing for Canada and living in Hungary A night in Győr: Bridget Carleton makes history, Part I A night in Győr: Bridget Carleton makes history, Part II A night in Győr: Bridget Carleton makes history, Part III However, it was Carleton’s Minnesota Lynx teammates, Napheesa Collier and Kayla McBride, who helped Fenerbahçe capture a second-consecutive EuroLeague Women crown in 2023-24.
Related
EuroLeague Women: Can Fenerbahçe repeat as champions? EuroLeague Women: Pivotal winner-take-all games set for league quarterfinals EuroLeague Women: Çukurova Basketbol Mersin hosts Final Four matchup against rival Fenerbahçe Alagöz Holding EuroLeague Women: It’s Villeneuve-d’Ascq vs. Fenerbahçe in the Sunday final! Fenerbahçe wins second-straight EuroLeague Women championship with dominant offensive performance The 2024-25 season, which features a new format, likewise has been defined by Fenerbahçe’s continued superiority, with the Turkish club again benefitting from the talent of past and present WNBA stars.
Related
EuroLeague Women: Groups drawn and new competition format instituted for 2024-25 season EuroLeague Women 2024-25 primer: Where to watch your favorite WNBA players this winter EuroLeague Women: Assessing the competition at the national team break WNBA players return to WCBA
Jonquel Jones. Photo by Lian Zhen/Xinhua via Getty Images The 2023-24 WCBA marked the return of WNBA players for the first time since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. WNBA standouts made an immediate impact, headlined by Jonquel Jones leading Sichuan to the title.
Related
WCBA Update: Sichuan wins title with Game 5 victory over Inner Mongolia The 2024-25 WCBA season again has emerged as a platform for WNBA players to show off their skills, highlighted, thus far, by an MVP-caliber season from Chennedy Carter.
Related
WCBA Update: Find out if your WNBA favorites are playing in China WCBA Update: Chennedy Carter headlines WNBA players who have been on heaters in China Vets, youngsters shine in WNBL
Sami Whitcomb. Photo by Adam Trafford/Getty Images The WNBL, likewise, offers an opportunity to WNBA players to develop their games during the offseason, regardless of their level of the experience. After former WNBA legend Lauren Jackson led the Southside Flyers to the 2023-24 WNBL title, veteran sharpshooter Sami Whitcomb has been stupendous for the Bendigo Spirit to start the 2024-25 season.
Related
WNBL: Perth Lynx, Southside Flyers will face off in Grand Final WNBL Update: From Sami Whitcomb to Lauren Cox, vets and Americans are setting the pace Down Under Otherwise, young WNBA hopefuls have used their time Down Under to burnish their resumes.
Related
WNBL Update: American players make an impact in Aussieland WNBL Update: As league celebrates Indigenous culture, Shaneice Swain emerges for Sydney Flames Interview: Shaneice Swain is lighting up the WNBL—and the WNBA might be next WNBL Update: Boosted by Veronica Burton, the Bendigo Spirit aren’t slowing down WNBL Update: How Naz Hillmon, Laeticia Amihere are keeping their Dream alive in Australia

Best of 2024: SC dominates, CC makes history and JuJu arrives Women’s college basketball was one of the big winners of 2024, with the sport surging behind Caitlin Clark’s history-making heroics, South Carolina’s dominance and new stars’ emergence. Relive the best NCAAW moments with Swish Appeal.
2025 WNBA Mock Draft 1.0 How much did the Golden State Valkyries’ selections in the 2024 WNBA Expansion Draft change things for the upcoming 2025 WNBA Draft? Probably very little! Still, it’s an opportunity to mock out a potential scenario for what might happen next spring, taking into account the recent performances of the world’s top draft-eligible players.
Best of 2024: Expansion, Unrivaled and more unknowns Much of the women’s basketball news in 2024 involved what could happen in 2025, including the debut of the Golden State Valkyries, the arrival of Unrivaled and a new WNBA CBA. Swish Appeal looks back at how the possibilities of 2025 helped define 2024.
An early look ahead to WNBA free agency Much change is expected ahead of the 2025 WNBA season. To get a head start on what your team might look like or where your favorite players might go, here’s a look at the 2025 WNBA free agents.
Best of 2024: Liberty, Lynx and rookies, oh my! It was quite a year for the WNBA, from the New York Liberty winning a long-sought championship to rookies rocking the league, and much more in between. Swish Appeal recounts the W’s most memorable moments. Loading comments...
